definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: Extending landfills CANNOT solve this exigent problem, do you ageree?
sentences.chinese: 扩建堆填区不能够解决这个急切问题，对吗？
愚蠢的地精急切地点点头。

sentences.english: The boy was too eager to get a geography book.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩非常急切地想要得到一本地理书。

sentences.english: He's champing at the bit to begin his new job next week.
sentences.chinese: 他正急切地想从下周开始新的工作。

sentences.english: Broaching the subject first implies you're more eager about money than about doing a good job.
sentences.chinese: 首先谈论薪水暗示你对金钱要比做好工作更急切。

sentences.english: Be anxiously concerned with the needs of the age ye live, and center your deliberation on its exigencies and requirements.
sentences.chinese: 应急切关注当代之需要，集中思考其危机和要求。

sentences.english: He wanted a drink badly. He picked at a dry piece of skin on his lip.
sentences.chinese: 他急切想喝点什么，用手指从嘴唇上撕下一小块干皮。

sentences.english: I was jazzed to see the remake, as I'm a huge fan of the original.
sentences.chinese: 我急切地想看这部重制，因为我是原版的忠实粉丝。

sentences.english: They are eagerly trying to buy the shoes and boots.
sentences.chinese: 她们都在急切地抢购各种鞋靴。

sentences.english: People have been anxiously awaiting another martial arts blockbuster from Zhang Yimou.
sentences.chinese: 人们一直在急切地等待着张艺谋的下一部武打大片。

sentences.english: We are anxiously awaiting the outcome of their discussion.
sentences.chinese: 我们急切地等待着他们讨论的结果。

sentences.english: I eagerly re-upped for this round, as well.
sentences.chinese: 我也急切地再次参与了这轮融资。

sentences.english: The workers leaped into the work of repairing the roof of the storehouse.
sentences.chinese: 工人们急切地开始修补仓库的屋顶。

sentences.english: I desperately needed to see results.
sentences.chinese: 但我急切需要看到结果。

sentences.english: Many residents are eager to know where the profits go.
sentences.chinese: 许多居民急切地想知道收益都到哪里去了。

sentences.english: They are ready and raring to go.
sentences.chinese: 他们已准备妥当急切想出发。

definition: to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
